Pros: Wide coverage: Safaricom has one of the widest network coverages in Kenya, with its services reaching most parts of the country, including remote areas. This makes it easier for customers to access its services, regardless of their location. Innovative services: Safaricom has been at the forefront of introducing innovative services in the Kenyan market, such as M-Pesa, a mobile money transfer service that has revolutionized the way people send and receive money in Kenya. The company has also introduced other digital services such as music streaming and e-commerce. Customer service: Safaricom has a strong customer service team that is always available to assist customers with any queries or issues they may have. The company has also invested in digital channels, such as social media, to make it easier for customers to access its customer service team. Competitive pricing: Safaricom offers competitive pricing for its services, which has helped it to attract and retain customers. The company also offers various promotions and discounts to its customers from time to time, making its services more affordable. Corporate social responsibility: Safaricom is committed to giving back to the community through its various corporate social responsibility initiatives. The company has invested in various projects in education, health, and environmental conservation, among others, which have had a positive impact on the communities it serves.
Cons: Service disruptions: Safaricom's network can experience disruptions from time to time, which can cause inconvenience to its customers, especially those who rely heavily on its services. High data costs: Safaricom's data costs can be relatively high compared to other providers in the Kenyan market, making it less accessible to some customers. Limited international coverage: Safaricom's international roaming coverage can be limited, which can be an issue for customers who frequently travel outside Kenya and need to use their mobile services while abroad. Privacy concerns: Safaricom's data handling practices have been questioned in the past, raising concerns about the privacy and security of its customers' personal information. Market dominance: Safaricom's dominance in the Kenyan telecommunications market has raised concerns about potential anti-competitive behavior, which could negatively impact other players in the market and limit customer choice.

Pros: Flexible work environment- very good for expectant mothers and young families. Management is understanding when it comes to health and family issues. Good facilities and amenities which include a gym, medical clinic, cafeteria, and a center which hosts several events ( although you will not get cheaper tickets by virtue of being an employee). Benefits include pension, medical, annual bonus. They also have a good SACCO and an investment cooperative for those keen on saving an extra penny or getting cheap loans.
Cons: You will be overworked and paid half the amount you would get for a similar job in another company. Growth is very slow. The company introduced a tiered structure which several job groups are in one level. You can move in terms of job group but your salary remains the same. Very difficult to grow especially if a starter since you have to wait for vacancies to fill up. It is a good company to learn and move to greener pastures. Also the annual increment is tied down to a percentage which cannot go beyond 10-15% and that is if you are an exceptional worker otherwise you get meager salary increments.
